intro: Boechera ophira, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial species typically grows in rocky habitats, such as alpine meadows and talus slopes. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Boechera ophira is notable for its ability to thrive in harsh, high-altitude environments.
